alert.note: Alert for Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 5:12PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Randolph, south central Lewis, southern Upshur and northeastern Webster Counties through 545 PM EST... At 511 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Holly River State Park, or 14 miles north of Webster Springs, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Elkins, Mill Creek, Dailey, Holly River State Park, Beverly, Womelsdorf (Coalton), Huttonsville, Alexander, Eden, Helvetia, Pickens, Cleveland, Alton, Hacker Valley and Kanawha Head. This includes Route 33 between mile markers 31 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away.
